get rid of somebody/something.translatio: to throw away or destroy something you do not want anymore
It’s time we got rid of all these old toys.
Governments should be encouraged to get rid of all nuclear weapons.
to take action so that you no longer have something unpleasant that you do not want
I can’t get rid of this cough.
He opened the windows to get rid of the smell.
to make someone leave because you do not like them or because they are causing problems
Are you trying to get rid of me?
It can be difficult for schools to get rid of poor teachers.
